subject: Re: Customizability (was: Re: [junit] Re: Filtering tests using anotations)
msgSnippet: ... Well, I don t know, as your question is pretty generic :-). The correct answer is: it probably depends from case to case, but I am pretty sure that there
messageBody:
On 3/28/07, David Saff <saff@...> wrote:
>
> On 3/28/07, Alexandru Popescu ☀ <the.mindstorm.mailinglist@...> wrote:
> > On 28 Mar 2007 06:46:04 -0700, roman.kitko <roman.kitko@...> wrote:
> > > I have implemented this myself, it was really easy
> >
> > Roman, I see what you are up to and it looks very interesting.
> > However, I would strongly encourage you to take a look at how TestNG
> > is handling groups, because I am sure you will find there a couple of
> > interesting features for your scenario:
>
> Alexandru,
>
> If Roman wants something somewhat different than what TestNG provides,
> is it easy to plug-in his custom behavior?
>
> David Saff

Well, I don't know, as your question is pretty generic :-). The
correct answer is: it probably depends from case to case, but I am
pretty sure that there are quite a few extension points in TestNG.

best,

./alex
--
.w( the_mindstorm )p.
